references.paper_title: A theory of learning from different domains
references.reason: This paper provides a theoretical foundation for domain adaptation, which is crucial for continual learning, especially in cross-domain scenarios.

references.paper_title: Gradient-based learning applied to document recognition
references.reason: This foundational paper introduced Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and their application to image recognition, a technique relevant to vision-language tasks and continual learning.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: CLIP, introduced in this paper, is a pivotal vision-language pre-trained model serving as a foundation for many downstream continual learning methods discussed in the target paper.
LwF, proposed in this paper, is a prominent continual learning method that addresses catastrophic forgetting;  it is directly compared with the proposed ZAF method.

references.paper_title: Overcoming catastrophic forgetting in neural networks
references.reason: This paper introduced the Elastic Weight Consolidation (EWC) method, a significant technique for continual learning that the authors' method builds upon and contrasts against.
